Categorize this IT Ticket:

please action submit your time cards for approval please action submit cards hi please assign thank regards pm please action submit cards please note he has left planning officer infrastructure upcoming holiday none please consider environment print please action submit cards dear receiving because cards haven submitted please note enough enter also make submit take corrective actions submitted card gets rejected breakdown submitted cards please submit accordingly possible country submitted cards card status entered total submitted cards submitted cards statuses explained error usually happens log calendar view period than days then delete which causes timecard switch error fix add back deleted delete entire timecard right hand side menu recreate again rejected card rejected by approvers please card entries accordingly resubmit entered status timecard few days entire timecard entered saved cards status has passed entered validation gone next submission step card issues resolve please wait corresponding resolutions

message.reasoning:
**Analyzing Ticket Content**

I'm currently focused on categorizing the IT ticket based on the text provided. I've broken down the text, noting the key phrase: "submit your time cards for approval". I am considering the list of categories provided: "Hardware|HR Support|Access|Miscellaneous|Storage|Purchase|Internal Project|Administrative rights" to determine the most relevant one. I am thinking HR support might be the right path.


**Considering HR Implications**

The ticket text, dealing with "time cards," has led me to strongly consider the HR Support category. The issue revolves around submission, corrections, and approval of time entries, solidifying its alignment with HR processes. I'm actively analyzing the text to confirm this connection.


**Revising Category Choice**

After further reviewing the ticket text concerning time card submission and associated issues, the HR Support category continues to be the most appropriate. The detailed description of submission, approvals, rejections, and error resolution strongly suggests this is an HR-related system or process issue. I've re-evaluated other options, but none align as closely with the core functionality of managing employee time entries.
